channel.title: Internet Speed and Cost Around the World
channel.description:
[img]http://i.imgur.com/cwiNV.jpg[/img]
Interesting stuff, Japan seems to be getting the right idea.

item.title: Internet Speed and Cost Around the World
item.dc:creator: @chri5 chri5
item.description:
@chri5 wrote:

[quote=“Niall, post:51, topic:324111”][quote author=chri5 link=topic=420515.msg3114976#msg3114976 date=1264885631]
I pay £20 /month for unlimited calls to UK landlines and “unlimited” 8mbps internet. My line speed is 4.1mbps I usually get ~350kb, which is 2.8mbps. I do download and upload ~150gb (max) total a month. They limit p2p though, but there’s always ways around that :). Tiscali, which has changed to Talk-Talk.

The UK really needs to upgrade their network… Fibre pl0x.
[/quote]

No, you need to get a better isp, or anything that isn’t tiscali.[/quote]

Yeah, contract runs out in July or so. I hope.

I wish I had fibre here… Damn Openreach and their shitty copper lines and equipment.

Also note I’m a cheap fuck broke student.

Read full topic
item.source: Internet Speed and Cost Around the World

item.title: Internet Speed and Cost Around the World
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“chri5, post:44, topic:324111”]I pay £20 /month for unlimited calls to UK landlines and “unlimited” 8mbps internet. My line speed is 4.1mbps I usually get ~350kb, which is 2.8mbps. I do download and upload ~150gb (max) total a month. They limit p2p though, but there’s always ways around that :). Tiscali, which has changed to Talk-Talk.

The UK really needs to upgrade their network… Fibre pl0x.[/quote]

No, you need to get a better isp, or anything that isn’t tiscali.

Read full topic
item.source: Internet Speed and Cost Around the World

item.title: Internet Speed and Cost Around the World
item.dc:creator: @bootnecklad bootnecklad
item.description:
@bootnecklad wrote:

[quote=“Greeny, post:49, topic:324111”][quote author=bootnecklad link=topic=420515.msg3115016#msg3115016 date=1264888830]
But who actually gets 50MB/s
[/quote]

It’s cable (fibre optic) so you do actually get it. It’s what I’d have been on if I hadn’t moved away from phone because we always seem to get offered the the new speeds as testers in my home area.

Where I am now we can’t even get cable so I get a lousy 6MB/s and it DCs all the time.[/quote]

Yeah I know that! I still have shitty terribad old copper…

Read full topic
item.source: Internet Speed and Cost Around the World

I do download and upload ~150gb (max) total a month. They limit p2p though, but there’s always ways around that :). Tiscali, which has changed to Talk-Talk.

The UK really needs to upgrade their network… Fibre pl0x.[/quote]

A lot of britain already has fibre, when my dad lived in essex he paid like £10/m and I could download shit at beyond 3mbyte/s.

item.dc:creator: @Telenim Telenim
item.description:
@Telenim wrote:

[quote=“maminerr, post:6, topic:324111”]i pay $100 a month for “ADSL+2” with “speeds up to 24mb/s”
and get about 24kb/s at the max.
Australia sucks for internet.[/quote]I pay $60 a month for ADSL+2

I was downloading a game earlier & it was at 2mb/s

I’m also australian.

Read full topic
item.source: Internet Speed and Cost Around the World

item.title: Internet Speed and Cost Around the World
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

[quote=“JaydenD12, post:36, topic:324111”][quote author=Yz85Racer link=topic=420515.msg3099841#msg3099841 date=1263636494]
I pay $50 AUD a month and get 120GB download limit. It’s ADSL2+, however I sync at like 5mbps if I’m lucky. Best speed I’ve ever got was 1.1mb/s.
[/quote]

Wtf, I pay $60 NZD per month for 20 GB download limit, and pretty crappy speeds also…[/quote]
yo ranga. I pay $30 for 10mbits and unlimited

Read full topic

item.title: Internet Speed and Cost Around the World
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

[quote=“MujaheD, post:32, topic:324111”][quote author=Lothy link=topic=420515.msg3092879#msg3092879 date=1263043247]

At Aussi’s: Shit internet is expected from your county; you are situated in the middle of nowhere.

how do you think the aussie’s would react to you telling them that they live nowhere?

Something like this:

Personal favourite, that one. :rolleyes: That day is probably the closest thing we’ll ever have to a revolution… at least until they try to prohibit alcohol.
[/quote]
Revolution? More like a few knuckle-heads that thought just because a few guys did something, it must be their race. PS anglo saxons came over to Australia too, except in chains.[/quote]
Yeah, I know. Ah well.

Read full topic
item.source: Internet Speed and Cost Around the World
